And the reason is, it

If you start multiplying--
if these are probabilities, and you start multiplying
them together, you get underflow issues
where your computer can't

represent a number so small. Like there is an
actual number there, but your computer just
can't represent it

in its standard representation. But computers do much
better when you're adding logs of probabilities.

You end up in spaces where
